padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/775391">Pianomelody</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-04-16">04/16/15 12:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>WOW !! Penhaligon's really compliments for this wonderful fragrance. As of now I'm loving it, is so mysterious, sweet, fantasy, .. spicy and sweet at the same time ... reading the story of Endymion, I catapulted those eras .. where the Goddess of the moon went to visit him every night ... is a perfume really classy, unique, really well done ... !!! notes harmonize with each other perfectly .. really a masterpiece! This scent surely, will enter among my favorites! :). HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! I think it can go for the autumn period.<br />
<br />
Sillage : 6./10 <br />
Longevity : 8.5/10<br />
Scent : 9.5/10<br />
<br />
Overall : 9.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="586617"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=586617#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent577087" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <br />
Frankincense in the dry down is very intensive. Don't mind the users intensity rating on it because it rarely used in west but here in Middle East is widely used.<br />
<br />
The Frankincese gives it the powdery feel for more intensive Franincese scenet try Tom Ford Sahara Noir</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="577087"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=577087#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent575582" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I dont get the la nuit comparisons whatsoever either. I see the barber shop thoughts though. Although this is not a strong fragrance performance wise, the scent it self is very strong, thick, and spicy, yet with a sorta transparent effect. Maybe its the frankincense that makes it like that. I dunno theres some interesting stuff going on here. But not my cup of tea at all, maybe skin chemisty? padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/41596">RUDOLFO512</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-03-06">03/06/15 05:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Endymion is my first cologne from Penhaligon. It is a beautiful lavender based cologne. At first spray it gives off a blast of lavender with citrus and spices. The dry down is very comforting, that is when the true lavender shines. I can get a wiff now and then and it makes me and my nose very happy. For a cologne it has good silage and last 5-6 hours on me. Beautiful!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="574412"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=574412#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent565674" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; This is nice stuff. Projection/longevity is not great. I'm doing what I do with Dolce and Gabbana the One: create a fragrance lotion tub by mixing unscented moisturizer and lots of this fragrance as well as wearing the deodorant to layer. This is worthy of going to that extra effort.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="565426"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=565426#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent556261" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc556261" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SNOOPY"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/33623"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.33623.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SNOOPY" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Habit-Rouge-L-Eau-13955.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13955.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Habit Rouge L'Eau"title="Habit Rouge L'Eau"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma556261ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd556261" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/33623">SNOOPY</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-01-07">01/07/15 15:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A beautiful barbershop style scent.<br />
A definite purchase at some future date.<br />
Extremely versatile and certainly in the masculine style.<br />
Only complaint was i get poor longevity,2 hours is about all so perhaps an atomizer would be a good idea with this.<br />
It is nothing like the current designer trends of recent years.<br />
Expensive too.<br />
Really do not care about the longevity as i would rather smell wonderful for a couple hours than smell like detergent or sweat all day.<br />
The longevity is probably due to more natural ingredients.<br />
Has the "feel" of an old fashioned aroma without actually being one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="556261"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=556261#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent540146" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc540146" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dicdic06"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/859514"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.859514.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dicdic06" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Laurent-Mazzone-Parfums/Ambre-Muscadin-13520.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13520.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ambre Muscadin"title="Ambre Muscadin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma540146ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd540146" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/859514">dicdic06</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-11-11">11/11/14 22:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Soapy and powdery scent, feel like hugging a ultral soft teddy bear. it doesnt stay long. only for 2 hours</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="540146"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=540146#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent533955" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc533955" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ericgoesta"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/390824"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.390824.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ericgoesta" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Five-O-Clock-Au-Gingembre-2764.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2764.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Five O'Clock Au Gingembre"title="Five O'Clock Au Gingembre"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma533955ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd533955" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/390824">ericgoesta</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-10-21">10/21/14 13:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This might be the ultimate "reliable and trustworthy - yet not boring or uninteresting - somewhat clean washed clooney-esque, father"-perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="533955"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=533955#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent521186" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc521186" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jassar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/631716"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jassar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma521186ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd521186" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/631716">Jassar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-09-08">09/08/14 18:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Truly great scent. It is great for fall and winter. Very smooth with no sharp edges. It is a niche version of Polo Double Black without the harsh pepper. Yes, it does have pepper in it but it is blended so well it comes across as just added smooth spice. Masculine, refined and sexy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="521186"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=521186#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent511996" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc511996" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Redbeard"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.537021.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Redbeard" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma511996ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd511996" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021">Redbeard</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-08-09">08/09/14 08:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a sweet but reassuringly mild powdery wood scent, with captivating florals and fruit in the top:  a sepia-colored satin ribbon with a stripe of magenta up the middle, that blends together over time into purple. Its cinnamon and trace of mocha remind me of a cross between Armani Code, L'Instant de Guerlain, and Van Cleef and Arpels minus the fetid moldiness, but it's still a bit feminine for me. I almost wish that it were light enough for me to handle a full day of it, because it's actually an intriguing scent, but I worry about how it would come across even if it were lighter. If I smelled this on a sophisticated woman, though, it would be drop-dead sexy!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="511996"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=511996#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent511593" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc511593" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Manny44"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/689591"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.689591.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="Manny44" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/La-Nuit-de-l-Homme-5521.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5521.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Nuit de l'Homme"title="La Nuit de l'Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma511593ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd511593" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/689591">Manny44</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-08-07">08/07/14 21:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Endymion is quite nice, maybe even very nice (think of a shy version of Versace's The Dreamer but with an added, and quite rich and robust actually, Coffee note) but its downfall is longevity. I wouldn't mind getting one as a gift but I'm  glad I bought Sartorial instead.<br />
<br />
Edit: Mmmm...despite longevity being below average and having to reapply every 3 hours this is still a very solid "like" for me. It is kind of ...heavenly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="511593"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=511593#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent504639" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc504639" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NeoXerxes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/801820"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="NeoXerxes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Dia-Man-1110.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1110.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dia Man"title="Dia Man"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma504639ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd504639" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/801820">NeoXerxes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-07-14">07/14/14 16:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Endymion would make John Keats proud.<br />
<br />
This is a fragrance that comes across as poetic, romantic, and intellectual. Endymion does not scream seduction - indeed, this fragrance does not scream anything. Rather it is a whisper in the ear, a biting of the lip. It is a reminder that, as Keats put it, "a thing of beauty is a joy for ever".<br />
<br />
This is a gentleman's fragrance... One that requires the wearer to be something more than the usual, else the lady who catches a whiff of this scent will lean in to find nothing hidden behind the curtain. <br />
<br />
If a man were to wear this to a club, he might find that he stands out, as if he does not belong in or near the repugnant clouds that follow those wearing the maniacally aggressive (and repulsive) One Million. For some this will be a good thing. For others not so much.<br />
<br />
Endymion is romance, not sex. Words of love, not heavy breathing and rustled sheets.<br />
<br />
"A thing of beauty is a joy for ever." True.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="504639"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=504639#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent458507" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc458507" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mossyoakpenn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/434895"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="mossyoakpenn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Slumberhouse/Norne-17418.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17418.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Norne"title="Norne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma458507ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd458507" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/434895">mossyoakpenn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-02-18">02/18/14 17:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Tons of lavender and bergamot in the opening of this one, and it smells very good.  After a little bit the lavender turns slightly powdery, still nice though.  Into the drydown, im getting a very minor hint of leather, almost undetectable.  <br />
<br />
This one smells very nice but at the same time its hard to smell.  Very soft, possibly I have slight anosmia to it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="458507"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=458507#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent425744" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc425744" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Houdini4"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.607493.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Houdini4" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Indemodables/Vanille-Havane-Coeur-de-Oud-96892.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96892.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"title="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma425744ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd425744" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493">Houdini4</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-11-12">11/12/13 13:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I can't deny that Penhaligon are masterful at blending fragrances, this one is nothing out of the ordinary. It's a prominent lavender with delicate spicing to create a fragrance which is not in your face more dignified I'd say. Clean &amp; masculine seems to be a theme which runs through all the male focused Penhaligons but nothing groundbreaking.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="425744"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=425744#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent424925" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc424925" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BlueMoon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/601683"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="BlueMoon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma424925ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd424925" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/601683">BlueMoon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-11-09">11/09/13 20:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>INDISTINGUISHABLE<br />
<br />
Top notes come off as a  soft yet masculine easy to wear fragrance.<br />
<br />
Dries down to a basic inoffensive powder.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="424925"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=424925#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent421922" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Maybe it's just me, but it sill smells good. Still worth the buy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="421922"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=421922#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent419276" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc414571" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HeavyMental"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/313816"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.313816.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="HeavyMental" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Roja-Dove/Burlington-1819-62320.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62320.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Burlington 1819"title="Burlington 1819"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma414571ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd414571" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); Don't pass on this one. Yes Longevity and projection are bad... Very bad, but it smells really good. My point is when you get to this level of fragrance "Niche" these scents should be for you and not for fishing for complements.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc408189" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lavaman"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/148843"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.148843.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lavaman" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma408189ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd408189" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/148843">lavaman</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-09-20">09/20/13 05:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A young man's scent. Nothing unpleasant a prominant lavender which I like very much. Never over powering with close to the skin sillage which would be great for work and even a signature scent.... You can easily find similar fragrances for far less, but nothing can beat Penhaligons mastery of blending. Suited for cooler weather would die off super fast in a warm climate. A well crafted scent, masculine and understated. I love the bottle with the dark blue labeling and bow</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="408189"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=408189#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent404018" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc404018" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="EarthBoundMisfit"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/275577"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.275577.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="EarthBoundMisfit" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mona-di-Orio/Vanille-12958.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12958.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille"title="Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma404018ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd404018" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/275577">EarthBoundMisfit</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-09-07">09/07/13 20:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This literally stopped my heart with it's spicy, green-thick warmth on the test strip. Could this be? Have I found IT? ... THE fragrance manifestation of all I am and hope to be? Alas..cruel, cruel chemistry world, it turns to old powder on me from 5 minutes through 2 hours into drydown. Moldy. Old. Powder. ( insert a stifled sob here )</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="404018"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=404018#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent399601" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc399601" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jwhdz1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/613552"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.613552.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jwhdz1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Santal-Noir-48378.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48378.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Santal Noir"title="Santal Noir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma399601ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd399601" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/613552">Jwhdz1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-08-24">08/24/13 20:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Never tire of this one. For me, it's happiness in a bottle!  Completely soothing and utterly charming, this dreamy concoction puts my mind and spirit at ease with it's comforting sweetness and warm embrace.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="399601"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=399601#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent394421" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc394421" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tororojo37"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/581618"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="tororojo37" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma394421ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd394421" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/581618">tororojo37</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-08-09">08/09/13 09:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The metamorphsis of this fragrance is astonishing to me. If the gentle citrus and floral were all that were present, then this would still be a pleasant enough scent that I would wear. But the sudden descent into the creamy, leathery, resinous depths is really thrilling. I am reminded of Russian tea I used to buy called Petrouchka that also had cardamom in it. It's as though the floral/citrus notes were a Japanese paper screen enclosing a Tolsoyish lounge on the other side with piping hot tea from the samovar, old books, old leather club chairs, and good cigars. The leather and the cardamom seem to effect a creaminess like when milk is added to strong black tea. <br />
     <br />
     What's remarkable is that this metamorphasis happens over and over again to those who come upon the fragrance. Hours later when you still smell the warm Tolstoy lounge on your skin, the echoes of the floral/citrus are still there. I do not begrudge to low sillage as this expert and masterful blending is a delicate balancing act that requires a gentle touch. <br />
<br />
     This is my favourite of Penhaligon's and women to go crazy for this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="394421"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=394421#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent392997" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc392997" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aussiecrew"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/534128"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.534128.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="aussiecrew" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5674.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Endymion"title="Endymion"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma392997ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd392997" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/534128">aussiecrew</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-08-05">08/05/13 03:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>'A thing of beauty is a joy for ever' from the poem ENDYMION by John Keats based on the Greek Mythology of the Moon Goddess Selene putting the mortal Endymion to sleep so he remains young and her lover forever. Endymion evokes seduction, wanting and obsession. Fresh, spicy, sweet with leather and musk that becons you with tantalising beauty. A scent that instantly draws you into a mesmerising and luscious dance of love and desire.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="392997"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=392997#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent387660" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc387660" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="The New Monaco"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/575569"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="The New Monaco" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mugler/A-Men-Pure-Havane-11444.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11444.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="A*Men Pure Havane"title="A*Men Pure Havane"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma387660ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd387660" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/575569">The New Monaco</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-07-18">07/18/13 11:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh, spicy, masculine. Great stuff!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="387660"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=387660#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent379194" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc379194" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Go4broke"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/283374"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.283374.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Go4broke" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sean-John/Unforgivable-2209.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2209.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Unforgivable"title="Unforgivable"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma379194ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd379194" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/283374">Go4broke</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-06-21">06/21/13 05:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm going to stick my neck out here and suggest that this fragrance (to me at least) is a masterpiece. It's so so beautiful, soft and deep, spicy and masculine. But Penhaligon's seriously need to work on their longevity issues.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="379194"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=379194#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent374748" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/536184">Lttdcn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-06-08">06/08/13 07:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought this for myself after trying the scratch-and-rub tester in some magazine when it was first released in the UK. Yes, I am female, and yes, feminine. :-) With my nose full of Something Else, I can't describe Endymion for you, other than to say, omg, this is liquid seduction in a bottle. Distinctive and memorable. Also, I agree with guest Mr P in that just when you think it's worn off, my wrist strays over the burner while I'm cooking and, oh my! There go my knees to jelly again!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="374748"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=374748#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent371317" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc371317" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LuckyStar1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2030"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2030.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LuckyStar1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/MYSLF-Le-Parfum-94983.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.94983.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="MYSLF Le Parfum"title="MYSLF Le Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma371317ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd371317" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2030">LuckyStar1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-05-28">05/28/13 14:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a new find for me and I am so glad I found it. It is so well made and is a truly classy fragrance. Starts off with a sweet mandarin with herbs and lavender and then the creamy coffee shines through. As this dries down the coffee is very noticible with a spiciness mixed through it. It has a powdery touch with musk and pepper. Completely masculine and for a cologne the longevity is superb. I have received many compliments from both men and women on this fragrance and I just love the scent. It was described as elegant,subtle and very sexy.<br />
This has become a very firm favourite of mine and this is definately staying in my collection from now on.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="371317"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=371317#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent345991" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc345991" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="malcner"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/451142"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="malcner" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma345991ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd345991" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/451142">malcner</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-03-15">03/15/13 08:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this scent, but it doesn't seem to last very long with me so I use a lot of it. Unfortunately, for that reason, I grudge buying a full bottle (but I still do!) It is lovely though and everyone I've encountered seems to think so too! Woman seem to love it...if that matters to you....<br />
I don't know if its just me, but as soon as I smelled this for the first time, I was instantly reminded of Boss Bottled....I still think so, only this smells a bit more up market to me and better quality.....but I suppose that could be my imagination. They aren't identicle but I sure smell some similarities. This is a lovely soft scent. Deep and masculine, a little spicy and a little sweet. Perfectly blended. One of my favourite penhaligon's!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="5674"comment_id="345991"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html?ccid=345991#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent329324" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; A quiet one. Perfect for commuting --  the kind you can wear without overwhelming other passengers... <br />
<br />
problem is - after a really short time it becomes one of those fugitive scents that you catch a passing whiff of every once in a while but most of the time hardly know is there at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; very appealing and masculine. Such excellent projection.<br />
